10:57 <ClemensR> btw: I am aware that I broke the escaping tests since http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-escaping/org.xwiki.enterprise$xwiki-enterprise-test-escaping/2464/  because of  XWIKI-13269  
10:58 <ClemensR> but I have no idea why, the code has not have escaped the < and > before, and it should not have done it as it returns JSON instead of HTML  
10:59 <ClemensR> the only change is that it now uses jsontool, and shows the results on a single line instead of several ones

11:50 <vmassol> hope I didn't break any; I'll fix them quickly if I did...

16:05 <vmassol> now ready to move out the markdown syntax from rendering…. some task for the next weekend! ;)  
16:05 <vmassol> I hope you like the new rendering amin ui  
16:05 <vmassol> \*admin  
16:29 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
17:01 <vmassol> reminder to self: fix this null....  
17:25 <boubou> has quit  
17:25 <vmassol> M-yflory: question for you  
17:26 <vmassol> I see you created http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Realtime+Netflux+Backend/  
17:26 <vmassol> I also see you put the following in there "You probably don't want to install this directly"  
17:26 <vmassol> so my question is: why have you created this page? ;)  
17:26 <vmassol> we only need to have pages that user want to install directly  
17:27 <cjd> I don't think he's connected atm  
17:27 <vmassol> he is  
17:27 <vmassol> (I checked before asking ;))  
17:27 <vmassol> but that's the main issue with vector.im IMO....  
17:27 <cjd> yeah, word on the street is everyone's using rocketchat  
17:28 <cjd> there is still no clear leader in the slack-clone sphere  
17:29 <cjd> I think he basically just copied Realtime+Backend which is where I originally wrote "You probably don't want to install this directly"  
17:30 <vmassol> same question for that one then  
17:30 <cjd> so it's installable w/ the extension manager :)  
17:30 <cjd> as a dependency  
17:30 <vmassol> nope  
17:30 <vmassol> for that you just need it to be in a maven repo  
17:30 <vmassol> which is the case already  
17:31 <vmassol> (when you do mvn release:perform it puts it in a maven repo)  
17:31 <vmassol> wtf….  
17:31 <vmassol> guest deleting pages?  
17:31 <vmassol> who's doing imports on xwiki.org?  
17:31 <M-yflory> Yes, I did that because it is based on a copy of the old relatime backend (sorry, I lost the connection to Vector)  
17:32 <evalica> has quit  
17:32 <vmassol> M-yflory: ok so no reason  
17:32 <tmortagne> vmassol: sounds more like an uninstall actually  
17:32 <vmassol> "A XAR import has been started by null in wiki platform" is an uninstall  
17:32 <vmassol> ?  
17:32 <tmortagne> talking about the deletes  
17:32 <KermitTheFragger> has quit  
17:33 <vmassol> yes but I was commenting about the the xar import when I asked who's doing imports  
17:33 <vmassol> M-yflory & cjd: if these are deps of other extensions then you may decide to not have them on exo  
17:33 <vmassol> the only reason to be on exo  
17:33 <cjd> If it's not on exo then we can't vote them 5 stars :D  
17:33 <tmortagne> vmassol: sorry not not answering quickly enough to "guest deleting pages?" then :)  
17:33 <vmassol> is to allow xwiki usres to find these extensions when inside EM in their wiki  
17:34 <vmassol> cjd: if they are deps of other extensions there's no reason to vote for them  
17:34 <vmassol> are you going to vote for the reandering link label generator?  
17:34 <cjd> no but we didn't write it :)  
17:34 <vmassol> (internal deps/extensons do not need to be visibile)  
17:34 <vmassol> doesn't make sense  
17:34 <vmassol> again, \*\*if\*\* they are deps  
17:34 <vmassol> you just need the top level exrensions to be there  
17:35 <vmassol> if you want to confuse users then what you're doing is definitely the best  
17:35 <cjd> but it's cool to have a documentation page for it  
17:35 <vmassol> create 10 extensions on exo  
17:35 <vmassol> which are used by a single app  
17:35 <vmassol> and name them similarly  
17:35 <vmassol> ;)  
17:35 <vmassol> then when user search they'll have some fun  
17:35 <vmassol> to decide what to do withit  
17:36 <vmassol> a doc page that has 1 line that says the user shouldn't use it?  
17:36 <cjd> yeah, indeed we need to work on search results only showing validated extensiosn  
17:36 <vmassol> you're serious?  
17:36 <vmassol> :)  
17:36 <vmassol> serious : it's cool to have a one line doc that the user shouldn't use it  
17:36 <vmassol> ?  
17:37 <vmassol> s/doc/doc saying  
17:37 <vmassol> sorry for my typos...  
17:37 <cjd> ahh ok, so the reason why the original RtBackend was using an extension page was because it wasn't released with maven in the beginning  
17:37 <vmassol> brain processing faster than fingers...  
17:37 <cjd> So I suppose we can delete those pages now  
17:38 <boubou> has joined #xwiki  
17:39 <vmassol> well to be sure  
17:39 <vmassol> what extension draws them?  
17:39 <cjd> All of the realtime stuff uses RtBackend (and in the next version it will all use Realtime+Netflux+Backend  
17:39 <cjd> )  
17:39 <vmassol> k  
17:39 <cjd> it is kind of cool to have the EM page in order to show that we developed Netflux in XWiki  
17:40 <vmassol> yes, providing you have nice documentation  
17:40 <vmassol> otherwise it has the opposite effect  
17:41 <vmassol> you can still add some text about netflux in the extension drawing it  
17:41 <vmassol> s/can/could  
17:41 <vmassol> anyway  
17:41 <vmassol> just wanted to let you know about the non-necessity to have extensions published on exo  
17:41 <vmassol> (since they're already in maven)  
17:41 <cjd> yeah, makes sense  
17:41 <vmassol> I'll let you decide what to do  
17:42 <vmassol> back to my other work ;)  
17:42 <cjd> have fun  
17:57 <ansuz> hi M-yflory
